mil3.3.2:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.3.2:1.2_0: “Since it is a Dīghāvu, that you’re alive. But you don’t get caught up in wisdom.”
mil3.3.2:1.3_0: “Great king, suppose a person were to store up the earth. But gradually, ri would grow, increase, and mature.
mil3.3.2:1.4_0: If they get seeds, provided, and cutting off it, they would grow and reach growth, increase, and maturity.
mil3.3.2:1.5_0: This is how they are far away?”
mil3.3.2:1.7_0: “In the same way, great king, you didn’t get thrilled with wisdom by the brahmins.”
mil3.3.2:2.2_0: “Great king, suppose a dogs were to break apart, then hags and chicks were chickped off their chickens.
mil3.3.2:2.3_0: This is how they are far away?”
mil3.3.2:2.5_0: “In the same way, great king, you didn’t get thrilled with wisdom by the brahmins.”
mil3.3.2:3.2_0: He brought the wheel, and said to the King,
mil3.3.2:3.5_0: “In the same way, there are these situations. The eye is a condition for sights. Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving. Craving is a condition for grasping. Grasping is a condition for continued existence. Continued existence is a condition for rebirth. Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
mil3.3.2:3.6_0: This is how they are far away?”
mil3.3.2:4.2_0: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving.’
mil3.3.2:4.3_0: This is how they are far away?”
mil3.3.2:4.5_0: “In the same way, great king, you didn’t get thrilled with wisdom by the brahmins.”
